programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Arizona (17-8, 11-3) dropped its last two games, but defeated the Bears, 81-70, on Jan. 14 behind 19 points from Henri Veesaar; Baylor (16-9, 8-6) is 12-1 at home behind Norchad Omier, who is the only player in the Big 12 averaging a double-double.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Duke (22-3, 14-1) is outscoring opponents by 20.2 ppg behind Cooper Flagg, who is second in the ACC with 19.8 ppg, and won 27 of its last 34 meetings with the Cavaliers after a 73-48 win last season; Virginia (13-12, 6-8) won three-straight games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 23 Kansas (17-8, 8-6) is 3-6 on the road this season despite Hunter Dickinson, who is fifth in the Big 12 with 16.4 ppg; BYU (17-8, 8-5) won six of its last eight games behind Richie Saunders, and upset the Jayhawks last season, 76-68.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: Jupiter Links GC (1-1-0) earned two points and secured its first win with a 4-3 overtime victory over Boston Common Golf on Jan. 27; New York Golf Club (0-2-0) suffered the first shutout in league history with a 4-0 setback to Atlanta Drive GC.

programme.desc: NC State (10-15, 3-11) seeks its first win away from home this season, starting 0-9; North Carolina (15-11, 8-6) beat the Wolfpack, 63-61, on Jan. 11 behind 21 points from Ian Jackson for its seventh win in the last nine meetings.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State (13-12, 7-7) had its six-game winning streak snapped by BYU, 80-65; Utah (14-11, 6-8) comes off a 74-67 upset of Kansas, and is 13-3 at home this season behind Gabe Madsen, who leads the Utes in scoring with 15.6 ppg.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Dominick Cruz (22-2, 7 KO's) has beaten his last 12 opponents, and defeated Faber by unanimous decision in their last meeting at UFC 132, on Jul. 2, 2011; Uriah Faber (33-8, 7 KO's) is coming off a win over Frankie Saenz at UFC 194 on Dec. 12, 2015.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The Bay Golf Club is led by Sweden's Ludvig Aberg, who is ranked No. 6 in the world; Boston Common Golf seeks its first win of the season after a 4-3 overtime loss to Jupiter Links GC on Jan. 27 and a 6-2 defeat to Los Angeles Golf Club on Feb. 4.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview UFC 303 and break down the main event as Alex Pereira (10-2-0) defends his light heavyweight title against Jiri Prochazka (30-4-1); other bouts include Brian Ortega (16-3) going up against Diego Lopes (24-6) in a featherweight bout.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1992, Deion Sanders, who was a two-way player with the Atlanta Falcons and an outfielder for the Atlanta Braves, attempts to play two National League playoff games and an NFL regular season game in a span of 24 hours in two different cities.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma (16-9, 3-9) dropped its last four games after an 82-79 loss to LSU; No. 2 Florida (22-3, 9-3) won four straight, and is 12-1 at home behind Walter Clayton Jr., who leads the Gators in scoring with 17.2 ppg and assists with 4.3 apg.

programme.title: The Hoop Collective
programme.desc: Brian Windhorst and a group of ESPN insiders cover anything and everything from around the NBA, breaking down the latest stories making headlines, recapping and previewing marquee matchups, and interviewing guests to gather their thoughts.

programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.desc: No. 5 Houston (21-4, 13-1) won four-straight games, and is 7-0 on the road behind the top scoring defense in the country, holding opponents to 57.3 ppg; Arizona State (12-13, 3-11) dropped its last five games after a 74-70 loss to TCU.

programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron secured his first win in "The Great American Race" last year, narrowly edging out Alex Bowman after the race went under caution; Joey Logano won four races last season en route to winning his third Cup Series championship.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State claimed a 65-62 victory over West Virginia in March's Big 12 quarter-finals round, led by 22 points and 11 rebounds from Ayoka Lee; JJ Quinerly posted 27 points and 4 rebounds for the Mountaineers in the postseason loss.

programme.title: 26th Annual Super Bowl Soulful Celebration
programme.desc: Professional football players and Grammy award-winning musicians share inspiring messages at the Mahalia Jackson Theater of Performing Arts in New Orleans.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Villanova (15-11, 8-7) upset the Huskies, 68-66, on Jan. 8 behind 23 points from Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 23.2 ppg; UConn (17-8, 9-5) is 10-2 at home this season behind Liam McNeeley, who leads the team with 15.1 ppg.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa and Ohio State split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Hawkeyes claiming a 93-83 victory in the final matchup on March 3; Caitlin Clark posted 35 points and 9 assists for the Hawkeyes in the home win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Minnesota (13-12, 5-9) won five of its last eight games behind Dawson Garcia, who is top five in the Big Ten in scoring with 19.2 ppg; UCLA (19-7, 10-5) won eight of its last nine games, and is 13-1 at home this season behind Tyler Bilodeau.

programme.desc: Illinois (17-9, 9-7) won its last nine meetings with the Badgers after an 86-80 win on Dec. 10; No. 11 Wisconsin (20-5, 10-4) won four-straight games, and is 12-1 at home behind John Tonje, who is top five in Big Ten scoring with 19.2 ppg.

programme.desc: No. 10 St. John's (22-4, 13-2) won its last six meetings with the Blue Demons after an 89-61 win on Dec. 17 behind 19 points from RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in Big East scoring with 17.6 ppg; DePaul (11-14, 2-12) is 10-6 at home this season.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett, who looks to win his 25th career title and move into a tie with Brian Voss for 11th all-time, leads the tour in points through two events; Graham Fach won the season opener.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: The ARCA Menards Series heads to the Ride the 'Dente 200 at Daytona International Speedway for the opening race of the season in Daytona Beach, Florida; Gus Dean claimed the race win at Daytona in the season opener from the 2024 season.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Ty Majeski won the finale at Phoenix last year over Corey Heim to claim his first Truck Series Championship; Nick Sanchez averaged 98.933 mph en route to his win in the opener last year, beating Heim under caution for his first Truck Series win.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: FC Cincinnati advanced to the Round of 16 in last year's edition before falling to Monterrey on aggregate, 3-1, while Honduran side Motagua is unbeaten in 12 of its last 14 contests across all competitions; inaugural meeting between the two sides.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami CF has won each of the two all-time meetings with Sporting Kansas City, including a 3-2 victory at Arrowhead Stadium in an MLS contest on April 13, as Luis Surez scored the match-winner off an assist from Diego Gmez in the 71st minute.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Seattle Sounders FC became the third American club to win the tournament after hoisting the crown in the 2022 edition; Guatemalan side Antigua GFC, which returns to the competition for the first time since 2016, is 0-2-2 all-time in the tournament.
